channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole, 28th July
item.description:
Pothole in Lane 4 of 4 M25 Clockwise just before marker "M25 A 167.8".
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M25, Navestock, Brentwood

item.title: Lampost light not working, 28th July
item.description:
Lampost on opposite side of the road from the front door of 18 Dryhill Road. The lampost is the 1st lampost on the left as you turn in to Grove Road from Dryhill Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 28th July
item.description:
Outside Christ Church on Broadway (near to Asda), Bexleyheath: Please could you remove graffiti from the top of two black public litter bins on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Broadway, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping in our bin area, 28th July
item.description:
At least 3-4 times per week stuff is dumped on our land. We’ve complained to southern housing and nothing gets done. It’s a health hazard. Sharp wood, oil kegs, petrol canisters, now a huge chest freezer dumped in a parking spot next to the bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Monteagle Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Takeaway shop at 28 Denbigh Street sign, 28th July
item.description:
The takeaway shop at 28 Denbigh Street has been placing a sign on the pavement each day to advertise pizzas. Given the recent investment in widening the pavement, this feels counterproductive. I'm also unsure whether businesses are permitted to place signs like this on the public footpath, blocking what is not a big space to advertise junk food.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Denbigh Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Willesden Lane/Aldershot Road, 28th July
item.description:
Graffiti

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Minster Road bus stop road surface damaged, 28th July
item.description:
Fell down boarding the bus due to the road surface damage. Fix immediately.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shoot-Up Hill, London

item.title: Dumped Items, 28th July
item.description:
Outside Crosby House on Crayford Road, Crayford: Please could you remove some dumped boxes from the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: Broken glass and rubbish blocking route, 28th July
item.description:
The underpass is strewn with rubbish, broken glass, and bricks. Almost impossible to pass through with a buggy and unsafe for children to walk. Also large tree branches on north side of underpass blocking path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Church Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 28th July
item.description:
Garden waste in bin liners fly tipped on sidewalk. On Hall View, SE9. Been there for a few days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46A, Grove Park Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 28th July
item.description:
Multiple potholes the whole length of Thane Villas, these have been getting deeper and more potholes have been appearing. Bits of debris are also on the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Thane Villas, Finsbury Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins used to reserve a parking spot, 28th July
item.description:
102 Lugard Road routinely uses bins to reserve a parking spot on what should be a free parking road. It’s difficult enough to find a parking spot on this busy road without 102 reserving a spot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lugard Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags flytipped, 28th July
item.description:
Bags of household rubbish left here. They are attracting a lot of flies and are horrible to have to walk past. This house also has rubbish dumped by their bins on the pavement at the front as usual.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sladedale Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Business littering on path, 28th July
item.description:
A&Z Dry cleaners & laundrette are taking their business onto the pavement blocking the path, using resident bins for their waste, parking on the pavement, and collection vehicles are blocking the road with their parking on an already congested street,
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clunbury Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trolley accumulating rubbish, 28th July
item.description:
Shopping trolley accumulating rubbish. Please remove, thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Triangle Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Flouting LTN cameras, 28th July
item.description:
Hi, the Enforcement Team must be aware of people who remove/obscure number plates to evade cameras. This person's a repeat offender, I noticed him again yesterday, Sunday 27 July, around 12:00. It's unacceptable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti, 28th July
item.description:
Graffiti on dog waste bin on 'cow path' It's hard to understand why someone would spend their time scribbling on a container full of animal excrement, but each to their own

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cow Path, Elmstead, London
